messages.text: Amazon: Your package (Order #113-7298036-2501824) has been delivered. It was handed directly to a resident. For more information, visit amazon.com/help

options.text: This is a legitimate delivery message
options.feedback: Correct! This is a legitimate message from Amazon. It includes a specific order number, doesn't ask you to click any links, and directs you to the official Amazon website if you need more information.

This is actually a legitimate delivery notification from Amazon. Notice that it includes a specific order number, doesn't create urgency, doesn't ask you to click any links, and references the official Amazon website.

options.text: Check if your package is actually at your door
options.feedback: Perfect! Verifying that you received the package is the best response to a delivery notification.

options.text: Log into your Amazon account to verify the order number
options.feedback: Good choice! Checking your order through the official Amazon website or app is a secure way to verify the delivery.
This is acceptable. Since the message doesn't ask you to take any action, ignoring it is safe, especially if you've already received the package.

options.text: Reply to the message to confirm receipt
options.feedback: This isn't recommended. Even with legitimate delivery notifications, you typically don't need to reply, and companies usually send these from numbers that don't accept replies.
